ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY

Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Was the student present at consultation
If invited, did they attend consultation

Notes: 1 = needs lots of repetition and visuals throughout; 2 = only needs a few reminders to pay attention/stay on task; 3 = Listens intently to instruction; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Level of Participation item 2 Motivation to complete tasks
Notes: 1 = Gives up easily with a challenging task and doesn't respond to motivators; 2 = Gives up initially; but responds to encouragement; 3 = Persists with challenging tasks; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Level of Participation item 3 Verbal expression
Notes: 1 = Is nonverbal; 2 = Has some phrases; 3 = Uses verbal communication; but below age equivalent; 4 = Fully fluent at expected age level; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Level of Participation item 4 Verbal comprehension
Notes: 1 = Needs pictures / visuals to understand; 2 = Understands verbal words and can follow verbal instructions (can complete the things I like task); but below age level; 3 = Understand verbal language at expected age level; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing.

1 = Flat affect; no smiling despite attempts to establish rapport; 2 = Smiles slightly in response to social engagement; but is quiet overall; 3 = Easily smiles and shows a range of affect; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Level of Participation item 6 Energy level
Notes: 1 = Lacks energy; lethargic; 2 = Average energy level; does not interfere with activity; 3 = Intense energy level; hard to contain and interferes with activity; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Level of Participation item 7 Repetitive behaviors
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Some; but doesn't interfere with the assessment; 3 = Intense and interfering with the assessment; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Level of Participation item 8 Completion of the things I like task
Notes: 1 = Unable to understand the picture version to make choices (e.g.; picked the same response for each item); 2 = Used the picture version and clearly made choices; 3 = Used the word version and clearly made choices; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing
